Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] On the Setting screen, i'll want to set the
 following for the NotMatchesFilePa
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=suaeAgU9Fd1bJNmMKtc_t6mZCzwJZWuqRrFWqQfhpKxu
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

There is also some information here:

http://www.dreamersrealm.net/~tree/blog/?p=4

As referenced from the FAQ here:

http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#midfetch

Note that the 'use cases' example assumes you only want URLs ending 
'.html' -- which will miss a lot of HTML content, which comes from a 
variety of URLs.

You enter the configuration information via the web administrative user 
interface, as described in the User Manual:

   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/wui.html
   http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual/config.html#submodules

Another other have noted, DecideRules are now preferred to Filters.

- Gordon @ IA

myepoch2008 wrote:

> On the Setting screen, i'll want to set the following for the 
> NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule:
> 
> decision: REJECT
> use-preset-pattern: CUSTOM
> regexp: .*(/|\.html)$
